Regular check-in post, with information about our rules and wikis Welcome to /r/depression's check-in post - a place to take a moment and share what is going on and how you are doing. If you have an accomplishment you want to talk about (these shouldn't be standalone posts in the sub as they violate the "role model" rule, but are welcome here), or are having a tough time but prefer not to make your own post, this is a place you can share.

Our subreddit rules are located in the sidebar (you can also always access them at /r/depression/about/rules) - since all of them exist for important safety reasons, we ask everyone here to read and follow them. Please click 'report' on any harmful content you see here - we always want to know and deal as soon as we can.
We also have several wikis there for help with finding and giving support:
/r/depression/wiki/what_is_depression provides guidance about what is and isn't a depressive disorder, guidance on the complex nature of the illnesses that are usually grouped under the "depression" label, and redirect information for common off-topic issues.
/r/depression/wiki/giving_help offers information on the nature and value of peer support for mental-health issues in general, and lots of guidance for learning what is -- and isn't -- usually helpful in giving peer support.
YSK that the types of rule violations that we most frequently see interfering with people getting safe and relevant support here are:

People breaking the private contact rule. You should never trust anyone who tries to get you into a private conversation in response to a post here. See /r/depression/wiki/private_contact
"I'm here to help" posts. This shows that you don't understand the most basic principles of peer support, especially selectivity. The "giving help" wiki explains more about this.
Role modelling, i.e. "achievement" or "advice" posts. This is an expert-free zone -- that's what peer support means (rule 5). We know that "internet culture" celebrate not just bragging about your achievements but bragging about your good intentions. Nothing like that is ever acceptable here.
Content that's more about 'making a statement' or casually polling the sub than seeking personal support (or, in a comment, giving it) (rules 1, 2 and 10).
Off-topic posts about difficult situations or circumstances, including interpersonal losses. Grief, sadness, anger, and other difficult emotions are not mental illnesses. The "what is depression" wiki has suggestions for other places to post about these issues, which are 100% valid and serious but inappropriate here.

I’m not looking toward going to work but I have to. I feel like as I’m getting older it’s just so hard not be depressed. I realized I’m just existing and waiting to be ended naturally. But I’m fortunate for the life. In my days off I like alone in my own little life just simple no arguing no crazy creepy people staring, no gossiping, no emotionally bullshit I have to deal with. At work I spent each days with these fucks 13 hours a day dealing with the fucking obsessions of gossiping. I’m so fucking tired.
I am such an unbelievably repulsive piece of shit human being

I'm having a hard time, I'm in the military. I'm getting medically separated due to destroying my right leg. It's been so hard dealing with my injuries and not being able to do all the things I used to. I'm pretty much on lock down here and have several limitations to what I can do. I haven't been home or off base in three years and now all of a sudden in less than two months they are going to throw me back into society. I have severe social anxiety and depression. I don't know if I can handle the real world. The people I'm surrounded with are absolute idiots who take nothing seriously. If I ask for help I get told "suck it up it's not that bad" or "I've seen a guy get blown up you don't know what depression is" it's frustrating. I feel so alone even though I'm surrounded by people. I just sit in a closet to cope bc it's the quietest place. I want someone to be with me but there's no one.

Why cant things just work out. Why does it always have to be a struggle. It feels like my entire existence is just being extremely anxious and then having my anxious thoughts confirmed by what happens. Whats the point in any of this? To be paranoid until I die? I don't understand.

Some days you’re alone with your thoughts and the memories of your most traumatic day(s) come flooding back if you’re not careful. It feels like a steady stream of work, exercise, friends, and [insert healthy coping mechanisms] can keep the worst of it at bay but sometimes I can feel it creeping up. Especially when you’re involuntarily surrounded by people who trigger it.
It’s been 8 months and 4 days but at least I can say I’m better now.

Going to the internet to read makes me feel less lonely alone vulnerable and I feel so much better about myself .
Because when I was in my worst, I have nobody to talk to and they’d made me feel as if there is nothing that they can do. 
The truth is even my family don’t understand they would try to say they understand but my family have stopped caring.
Since I was young girl I have always been very empath, I can take in a lot, I can take in poverty and all the hard emotions I was into the sad documentaries and wish that one day I can help poor people my best friends are always poor and I help whenever I can. 
I was dreaming of just having a simple life with my wife is all the fantasies I can have. 
In most of my time I work for non profit organization helping the poor and the children who wants to read and write but didn’t have an access to. 
Then i have the private life with my wife, when I can i can fly back to her and be with her even just for a week. Just simple. 
Those are my outmost dream and what my heart seek, just simple, a wife and to help people. 
But I just can’t find the courage and to start looking for such dream and goal....
All now is just depressing circles.
Struggling to get exercise into my routine. I've tried taking it small but id rather sleep in bed or be on the computer. Any idea how I can get started?

I'm so crushed. You're already dating someone else. I just want to stop feeling this pain. Why does it take me so long to get over people????? I wish I could forget you. I'm in so much pain. You don't even want to talk to me anymore. I miss you so much but know you'll never come back. I'm so sad. Because I'm an awful human being you couldn't love me. I need to die. And you wouldn't even know if I did. Ha.
